alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 9:42AM CDT until May 29 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Republican River At Cambridge affecting Furnas County. For the REPUBLICAN RIVER...including Riverton, Cambridge, Orleans, Guide Rock, Hardy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Republican River At Cambridge. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs as the right bank overflows. Water will start flowing through sloughs south of the main channel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 2.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to near flood stage around midday Sunday. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 04/25/2007. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
